description.en: Born near the Vedāchala mountain as the son of Vimalākṣa and well-known as Suśīlakamalākṣa, after renunciation became Citsukha; having had the authority of the preceptor-ship of Kāñci, He lived in the caves of Sahya mountain. He, having installed/deputed Citsukhānanda Yogīndra in his place, vanished fully on the sixth day of the bright fortnight of the month of Āṣāḍha of the year Dhātu. His preceptor-ship was for twenty-seven years.

shlokas:
vEdAcalAntikabhavO vimalAkSanAmnaH sUnuH suzIlakamalAkSa iti prasiddhaH.
saMyamya citsukhatanuH zritakAmakOTIpIThAdhipatyavibhavO'pyavasat sa sahyE..68..
citsukhAnandayOgIndraM nivEzya nijaviSTarE.
sarvAtmanA tirO'dhAt sa dhAtvASADhAcchaSaSThyahE..69..
—puNyazlOkamaJjarI
